Parameters: the listener where the results of the asynchronous @B_com#google#android#gms#common#api#GoogleApiClient#connect_E@ call are delivered.
registerConnectionFailedListener(com.goo.Description: Registers a listener to receive connection failed events from this GoogleApiClient. Unlike @B_com#google#android#gms#common#api#GoogleApiClient#registerConnectionCallbacks_E@, if the service is not already connected, the listener's @B_com#google#android#gms#common#api#GoogleApiClient#OnConnectionFailedListener#onConnectionFailed_E@ method will not be called immediately. Applications should balance calls to this method with calls to @B_com#google#android#gms#common#api#GoogleApiClient#unregisterConnectionFailedListener_E@ to avoid leaking resources. If the specified listener is already registered to receive connection failed events, this method will not add a duplicate entry for the same listener. Note that the order of messages received here may not be stable, so clients should not rely on the order that multiple listeners receive events in.

Returns: the pending result is fired once the default account has been cleared, but before the client is reconnected - for that @B_com#google#android#gms#common#api#GoogleApiClient#ConnectionCallbacks_E@ can be used.
clearDefaultAccountAndReconnect().Description: Clears the account selected by the user and reconnects the client asking the user to pick an account again if @B_com#google#android#gms#common#api#GoogleApiClient#Builder#useDefaultAccount_E@ was set.

Returns: true if the client is connected to the service.
isConnected().Description: Checks if the client is currently connected to the service, so that requests to other methods will succeed. Applications should guard client actions caused by the user with a call to this method.

Returns: true if the client is attempting to connect to the service.
isConnecting().Description: Checks if the client is attempting to connect to the service.

getSessionId().Description: Returns a unique session id for this GoogleApiClient instance, which should remain the same even if the current connection state changes.

blockingConnect().Description: Connects the client to Google Play services. Blocks until the connection either succeeds or fails. This is not allowed on the UI thread. If the client is already connected, this methods returns immediately. If the client is already connecting (for example due to a prior call to @B_com#google#android#gms#common#api#GoogleApiClient#connect_E@), this method blocks until the existing connection attempt completes. If a prior connection attempt has already failed, then a new connection attempt is started.

Returns: true if the specified listener is currently registered to receive connection failed events.
isConnectionFailedListenerRegistered(com.Description: Returns true if the specified listener is currently registered to receive connection failed events.

Returns: true if the specified listener is currently registered to receive connection events.
isConnectionCallbacksRegistered(com.goog.Description: Returns true if the specified listener is currently registered to receive connection events.

Parameters: The @B_com#google#android#gms#common#api#Api_E@ to retrieve the ConnectionResult of. Passing an API that was not registered with the GoogleApiClient results in an IllegalArgumentException.
getConnectionResult(com.google.android.g.Description: Returns the @B_com#google#android#gms#common#ConnectionResult_E@ for the GoogleApiClient's connection to the specified API. This method must only be called after @B_com#google#android#gms#common#api#GoogleApiClient#connect_E@ has been called and before @B_com#google#android#gms#common#api#GoogleApiClient#disconnect_E@ is called. This method may return stale results if the GoogleApiClient is reconnecting due to a lost network connection. It is guaranteed to return the most recent ConnectionResult from attempting to connect the given API, but will throw an IllegalStateException if called before calling connect or after calling disconnect. This method can be used to easily determine why an API failed to connect if it was not available. To determine whether a given API is currently connected (without potential stale results) see @B_com#google#android#gms#common#api#GoogleApiClient#hasConnectedApi_E@.

Parameters: the time unit of the timeout argument
blockingConnect(long, java.util.concurre.Description: Connects the client to Google Play services. Blocks until the connection either succeeds or fails, or the timeout is reached. If the client is already connected, this methods returns immediately. If the client is already connecting (for example due to a prior call to @B_com#google#android#gms#common#api#GoogleApiClient#connect_E@), this method blocks until the existing connection attempt completes or the timeout is reached. If a prior connection attempt has already failed, then a new connection attempt is started.
blockingConnect(long, java.util.concurre.FullName: public abstract ConnectionResult blockingConnect (long timeout, TimeUnit unit)

Parameters: The @B_com#google#android#gms#common#api#Api_E@ to test the connection of.
hasConnectedApi(com.google.android.gms.c.Description: Returns whether or not this GoogleApiClient has the specified API in a connected state.

reconnect().Description: Closes the current connection to Google Play services and creates a new connection. This method closes the current connection then returns immediately and reconnects to the service in the background. After calling this method, your application will receive @B_com#google#android#gms#common#api#GoogleApiClient#ConnectionCallbacks#onConnected_E@ if the connection is successful, or @B_com#google#android#gms#common#api#GoogleApiClient#OnConnectionFailedListener#onConnectionFailed_E@ if the connection failed.

unregisterConnectionFailedListener(com.g.Description: Removes a connection failed listener from the GoogleApiClient. Note that removing a listener does not generate any callbacks. If the specified listener is not currently registered to receive connection failed events, this method will have no effect.

Parameters: the activity managing the client's lifecycle.
Throws: if called from outside of the main thread.
stopAutoManage(android.support.v4.app.Fr.Description: Disconnects the client and stops automatic lifecycle management. Use this before creating a new client (which might be necessary when switching accounts, changing the set of used APIs etc.). This method must be called from the main thread.

Parameters: the listener where the results of the asynchronous @B_com#google#android#gms#common#api#GoogleApiClient#connect_E@ call are delivered.
registerConnectionCallbacks(com.google.a.Description: Registers a listener to receive connection events from this GoogleApiClient. If the service is already connected, the listener's @B_com#google#android#gms#common#api#GoogleApiClient#ConnectionCallbacks#onConnected_E@ method will be called immediately. Applications should balance calls to this method with calls to @B_com#google#android#gms#common#api#GoogleApiClient#unregisterConnectionCallbacks_E@ to avoid leaking resources. If the specified listener is already registered to receive connection events, this method will not add a duplicate entry for the same listener, but @B_com#google#android#gms#common#api#GoogleApiClient#ConnectionCallbacks#onConnected_E@ method if currently connected. Note that the order of messages received here may not be stable, so clients should not rely on the order that multiple listeners receive events in.

unregisterConnectionCallbacks(com.google.Description: Removes a connection listener from this GoogleApiClient. Note that removing a listener does not generate any callbacks. If the specified listener is not currently registered to receive connection events, this method will have no effect.

disconnect().Description: Closes the connection to Google Play services. No calls can be made using this client after calling this method. Any method calls that haven't executed yet will be canceled. That is @B_com#google#android#gms#common#api#ResultCallback#onResult_E@ won't be called, if connection to the service hasn't been established yet all calls already made will be canceled.

Parameters: Desired prefix to prepend at each line of output.
The raw file descriptor that the dump is being sent to.
The PrintWriter to use for writing the dump.
Additional arguments to the dump request.
dump(java.lang.String, java.io.FileDescr.Description: Prints the GoogleApiClient's state into the given stream.
dump(java.lang.String, java.io.FileDescr.FullName: public abstract void dump (String prefix, FileDescriptor fd, PrintWriter writer, String[] args)

connect().Description: Connects the client to Google Play services. This method returns immediately, and connects to the service in the background. If the connection is successful, @B_com#google#android#gms#common#api#GoogleApiClient#ConnectionCallbacks#onConnected_E@ is called and enqueued items are executed. On a failure, @B_com#google#android#gms#common#api#GoogleApiClient#OnConnectionFailedListener#onConnectionFailed_E@ is called. If the client is already connected or connecting, this method does nothing.

ClassDesc: The main entry point for Google Play services integration. GoogleApiClient is used with a variety of static methods. Some of these methods require that GoogleApiClient be connected, some will queue up calls before GoogleApiClient is connected; check the specific API documentation to determine whether you need to be connected. Before any operation is executed, the GoogleApiClient must be connected using the @B_com#google#android#gms#common#api#GoogleApiClient#connect_E@ method. The client is not considered connected until the @B_com#google#android#gms#common#api#GoogleApiClient#ConnectionCallbacks#onConnected_E@ callback has been called. When your app is done using this client, call @B_com#google#android#gms#common#api#GoogleApiClient#disconnect_E@, even if the async result from @B_com#google#android#gms#common#api#GoogleApiClient#connect_E@ has not yet been delivered. You should instantiate a client object in your Activity's @B_android#app#Activity#onCreate_E@ method and then call @B_com#google#android#gms#common#api#GoogleApiClient#connect_E@ in @B_android#app#Activity#onStart_E@ and @B_com#google#android#gms#common#api#GoogleApiClient#disconnect_E@ in @B_android#app#Activity#onStop_E@, regardless of the state.
